Task 18: What is OpenROAD Workbench?

Object-oriented programming (OOP) is a type of software development in which you organize your application as a collection of objects that can be created and destroyed at will. Objects are instances of classes. They have attributes associated with them and are able to perform tasks specified in methods. Objects can be created or destroyed at will.
